title: Horrible FPS drops; restarting the game seems to be the only help (MOST of the time)?
body:
Hello fellow summoners,
I was only wondering if someone else had been experiencing a simmilar problem lately, and how to fix it.
My frame rate never drops below 120-130 mark, but every few games, i start with 15-30 fps and it doesn't go up/normalize unless i exit the game entirely and  reconnect again (which, ofc, costs me xp and gold every time). 
At first i thought it was some virus or process that was skyrocketing my cpu to 70-80% every now an then (since I've seen random cpu usage spikes in Task Manager), but after I checked my computer for malware, shut down all unnecessary processes, and even did a major update of the system last night (400+ mb of updates, which I reckon should've been the last reason for the fps drops), even did a repair on both game and the client, the problem, as you've guessed it, persists.
I appreaciate all the help I hope I'll get.

replies.body: If your cpu is shooting up to 70-80%, there's probably something that is having a really hard time interacting with League any time a game starts. It could be due to some kind of bad software/driver interaction. Let's be sure to check the most common solutions with our [**FPS guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting). Hit me back up if that doesn't seem to help!

I managed to solve the issue, at least for now. Than I went to play ranked game, client (old version) froze and i couldn't shut it down properly, nor start the new one. Apparently my team reported me because they had to remake, and now I have 5x20min low priority. One night after doing 5x10min low priority, also because of client crashes. Is there any chance I get my low priority queue lifted, because this is SERIOUSLY not fair. It's like doing prison time twice 'cause someone else committed murders. 
PS. I used Razer Cortex (game booster)
Another notice; fps is now what I can consider 'normal', but it changes with an amplitude of +/-70 fps (usually from around 90 to 220).
